trans-unit.source: Many trigger actions need to access the values of the rows being changed.

seg-source.mrk: Many trigger actions need to access the values of the rows being changed.

target.mrk: Many trigger actions need to access the values of the rows being changed.

trans-unit.source: Such trigger actions need to know one or both of the following:

seg-source.mrk: Such trigger actions need to know one or both of the following:

target.mrk: Such trigger actions need to know one or both of the following:

trans-unit.source: The "before" values of the rows being changed (their values before the database event that caused the trigger to fire)

seg-source.mrk: The "before" values of the rows being changed (their values before the database event that caused the trigger to fire)

target.mrk: The "before" values of the rows being changed (their values before the database event that caused the trigger to fire)

trans-unit.source: The "after" values of the rows being changed (the values to which the database event is setting them)

seg-source.mrk: The "after" values of the rows being changed (the values to which the database event is setting them)

target.mrk: The "after" values of the rows being changed (the values to which the database event is setting them)

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides transition variables and transition tables for a trigger action to access these values. See "Referencing old and new values: the REFERENCING clause" under the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides transition variables and transition tables for a trigger action to access these values.
See "Referencing old and new values: the REFERENCING clause" under the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides transition variables and transition tables for a trigger action to access these values.
See "Referencing old and new values: the REFERENCING clause" under the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.
